author: barnabasbusa
content: through the launchpad its not possible

author: barnabasbusa
content: launchpad is going to detect that a deposit has been made already for the validator and does not care about it being exited.

author: sanjayy1702
content: what if we directly call the deposit function in the contract instead of calling via launchpad , will it work

author: sproul
content:
the deposit will go through and the beacon chain will process it, but it will never re-activate the validator

the validator balance on the beacon chain will increase until the next scheduled ~~partial~~ full withdrawal

see: https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/beacon-chain.md#deposits

in particular

```python
if pubkey not in validator_pubkeys:
  # we don't take this branch
  ...
else:
  # we *do* take this branch
  # Increase balance by deposit amount
  index = ValidatorIndex(validator_pubkeys.index(pubkey))
  increase_balance(state, index, amount)
```

author: sanjayy1702
content: what will happen in the next partial withdrawal, will be get that balance back

author: sanjayy1702
content: i think we only get partial if balance is grater than 32 eth, and if we are able to add balance in the validator once is exited and lets say we added 32, will it not become active then too?

author: sproul
content:
ah yeah sorry, it's not a partial withdrawal but another full withdrawal

see: <https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/capella/beacon-chain.md#is_fully_withdrawable_validator>

author: sproul
content: yes, you get the balance back in the withdrawal address

author: sproul
content: there's no code path where inactive validators become active again, that's definitely impossible

author: sproul
content: even if you get to 32 ETH
